SEARCH
Package database

Class DataSource

java.lang.Object
database.DataSource
public class DataSource extends Object
This class is meant to be the single touch point to reach the database. It is therefore modelled using the \ Singleton pattern so that only one database Connection object is ever created.

  • Method Details

    • getInstance

      public static DataSource getInstance()
      Returns the static instance of the singleton database.DataSource.
      Returns:
      A reference to the database.DataSource object
      Throws:
      SQLException - If a connection could not be established. Ensure that the connection parameters are correct and the database is reachable and running.

    • getInstance

      public static DataSource getInstance(DatabaseCredentials newCredentials)
      Returns the static instance of the singleton database.DataSource, instantiating one if it doesn't exist yet using the set of credentials provided.
      Parameters:
      newCredentials - The database.DatabaseCredentials object to apply.
      Returns:
      A reference to the database.DataSource object

    • databaseExists

      private boolean databaseExists() throws DatabaseException
      Checks if the correct database schema exists by querying the information schema.
      Returns:
      true if the database exists.
      Throws:
      SQLException - If an error occurs with the database connection.
      DatabaseException

    • createDatabase

      private void createDatabase() throws DatabaseException
      Creates the required database schema
      Throws:
      SQLException - If an error occurs with the database connection.
      DatabaseException

    • initialiseDatabase

      public void initialiseDatabase() throws DatabaseException
      Helper method. Creates the database schema if required and set it as default. Then creates and initialises the books table if required.
      Throws:
      SQLException - If an error occurs with the database connection.
      DatabaseException

    • checkAndInitialiseTables

      private void checkAndInitialiseTables() throws DatabaseException
      Brings the database into a valid state during the first run. Checks if each of the required tables exists and creates them with their starting data. The tables are added in the correct order according to their dependency on one another.
      Throws:
      DatabaseException - If a database error occurs during the process.

    • tableExists

      private boolean tableExists(String tableName) throws DatabaseException
      Checks to see if a table of the given name exists in the current database. This method assumes the database already exists. An SQL Exception will be thrown if the database doesn't exist yet.
      Returns:
      true if the database table exists.
      Throws:
      SQLException - If an error occurs with the database connection or the database doesn't exist yet.
      DatabaseException

    • executeUpdate

      private int executeUpdate(String sql) throws DatabaseException
      Throws:
      DatabaseException

    • executeBatchInsert

      private void executeBatchInsert(List<String> insertQueries) throws DatabaseException
      Helper method for bulk execution of INSERT queries. Used for inserting initial data into the database.
      Parameters:
      insertQueries - A list of Strings (INSERT queries)
      Throws:
      DatabaseException - If a database error occurs.

    • getProjectsByStringSearch

      private List<Project> getProjectsByStringSearch(String whereClause, String stringParameter) throws DatabaseException
      Helper method that searches for project with a custom WHERE clause that must have an unsafe String applied as a parameter. Use this when handling a search term received from the user.
      Parameters:
      whereClause - The WHERE clause to use (should not end with a ';')
      stringParameter - A string parameter that may be unsafe in terms of SQL injection.
      Returns:
      A list of result (Project objects)
      Throws:
      DatabaseException - If a database error occurs.

    • getProjectsBySearch

      private List<Project> getProjectsBySearch(String whereClause) throws DatabaseException
      Helper method that searches for project with a custom WHERE clause.
      Parameters:
      whereClause - The WHERE clause to use (should not end with a ';')
      Returns:
      A list of result (Project objects)
      Throws:
      DatabaseException - If a database error occurs.

      public Project getProjectByNumber(long number) throws DatabaseException

      Parameters:
      number - The project number
      Returns:
      A Project object
      Throws:

    • getCurrentProjects

      public List<Project> getCurrentProjects() throws DatabaseException
      Returns a list of all projects that have not been finalised, whose deadline date is either NULL or in the future.
      Returns:
      A list of currently active and not overdue projects.
      Throws:
      DatabaseException - If a database error occurs

    • getOverdueProjects

      public List<Project> getOverdueProjects() throws DatabaseException
      Return a list of the projects that are not finalised and whose deadline date is before the current date.
      Returns:
      List of overdue projects
      Throws:
      DatabaseException - If a database error occurs.

    • getProjectsByName

      public List<Project> getProjectsByName(String searchTerm) throws DatabaseException
      Throws:
      DatabaseException

    • getProjectsByAddress

      public List<Project> getProjectsByAddress(String searchTerm) throws DatabaseException
      Throws:
      DatabaseException

    • getProjectsByString

      private List<Project> getProjectsByString(String searchTerm, String column) throws DatabaseException
      Helper method for finding project by searching for a search string in a specified column. The search is hardened against SQL injection so this method may accept user input.

      Used by getProjectsByName and getProjectsByAddress above.

      Parameters:
      searchTerm - The string to
      column - The name of the column to search in
      Returns:
      A list of projects that match the search criteria.
      Throws:
      DatabaseException - If a database error occurs or the search column supplied is not in the Projects table.

    • getProjectsByPerson

      public List<Project> getProjectsByPerson(Person personToSearch) throws DatabaseException
      Queries the database for projects where the given person is involved (regardless of their role).
      Parameters:
      personToSearch - The person to search for. This object must have come from one of the search/creation functions in this class to ensure that it has a valid database ID.
      Returns:
      A list of Project objects. If the query return no results, the list will be empty.
      Throws:
      DatabaseException - Some database error occurred (most likely an access error). Inspect the throwable contained within for more details.

    • getListOfProjectsFromResultSet

      private List<Project> getListOfProjectsFromResultSet(ResultSet resultSet) throws SQLException
      Iterates through a given ResultSet that came from the Projects table and creates a Project object from each of the rows.
      Parameters:
      resultSet - The ResultSet as it was received from the Statement, with the cursor in the default position.
      Returns:
      A list of project objects. If the query returned no results then the list returned will be empty.
      Throws:
      SQLException - If some DB access error occurs or if the ResultSet is from the wrong table (not the Project table) and thus the column names don't match.

    • getProjectFromResultSet

      private Project getProjectFromResultSet(ResultSet resultSet) throws SQLException
      Creates a Project object from the current row of the given ResultSet. Typically, you don't call this method directly and rather call getListOfProjectsFromResultSet which in turn calls this method. This method expects the cursor to be pointing at a valid row to be in the ResultSet (not before the first row or after the last).
      Parameters:
      resultSet - A ResultSet from a query of the Projects table with the cursor pointing at a valid row.
      Returns:
      A Project object created from the data in the row.
      Throws:
      SQLException - If some DB access error occurs or if the ResultSet is from the wrong table (not the Project table) and thus the column names don't match.

    • getProjectTypeByID

      private ProjectType getProjectTypeByID(long ID)

    • getProjectStatusByID

      private ProjectStatus getProjectStatusByID(long ID)

    • getPersonByID

      private Person getPersonByID(long ID) throws SQLException
      Throws:
      SQLException

    • insertProject

      public long insertProject(String projectName, ProjectType type, Person customer) throws DatabaseException
      Executes a query to add a new project to the database with the given parameters


      This method assumes that the correct default database has been and that the book table already exists. This method uses prepared statements to handle sanitising of the user input to prevent SQL injection attacks.

      Parameters:
      projectName - The name of the new project. (Does not need to be unique in the database)
      type - The ProjectType enum value of the project.
      customer - A Person Object representing customer. This represent a person already in the database (i.e. have a valid id number).
      Returns:
      The project number of the new record or -1 on failure
      Throws:
      SQLException - If an error occurs with the database connection.
      DatabaseException

    • insertProject

      public long insertProject(Project projectToInsert) throws DatabaseException
      Adds a project to the database
      Parameters:
      projectToInsert - The project to add.
      Returns:
      The new project number. Should be applied to the object to maintain consistency.
      Throws:
      DatabaseException - If a database error occurs.

      public long insertPerson(String firstName, String surname, String address, String email) throws DatabaseException

      Parameters:
      firstName -
      surname -
      address -
      email -
      Returns:
      The ID of the new record. Should be applied to the in-memory object representing this Person.
      Throws:
      DatabaseException - if a database error occurs.

      public boolean deleteProject(long projectNumberToDelete) throws DatabaseException

      Parameters:
      projectNumberToDelete - The Project number of the record to delete.
      Returns:
      true if the table is modified.
      Throws:
      DatabaseException - If an error occurs with the database connection.

    • deleteProject

      public boolean deleteProject(Project projectToDelete) throws DatabaseException
      Deletes the record associated with the given Project object.
      Parameters:
      projectToDelete - A Project object representing the record to be deleted.
      Returns:
      true if the database was modified.
      Throws:
      DatabaseException - If an error occurs with the database connection.

    • updateProject

      public boolean updateProject(Project projectToChange, HashMap<String,Object> changes) throws DatabaseException
      Called from the update menu. Changes several fields of a project in the database at once.
      Parameters:
      projectToChange - The Project to change
      changes - A hash map of changes where the key is the column to change and the value is the new value.
      Returns:
      true if the database is modified.
      Throws:
      DatabaseException - if a database error occurs.

    • changeStage

      public boolean changeStage(long projectNumber, long newStage) throws DatabaseException
      Changes the project status of the given project. The validation check of this change is done in the Project object.
      Parameters:
      projectNumber - The ID of the project to change.
      newStage - The ID of the new project stage.
      Returns:
      true if the database is changed
      Throws:
      DatabaseException - If a database error occurs.

    • getAllPeople

      public List<Person> getAllPeople() throws DatabaseException
      Returns all people in the database as a list.
      Returns:
      A list of all the people in the database.
      Throws:
      DatabaseException - If a database error occurs.

    • searchPeople

      public List<Person> searchPeople(String searchName) throws DatabaseException
      Searches the database for the given name and returns a list of Persons that likely match it. Searches both first name and surname fields and priorities results where the search term appears at the start of the field (i.e. the user typed exactly want they wanted), thereafter returns results where the search term is somewhere in the middle of the field (i.e. the user entered some approximate value).
      Parameters:
      searchName - The string to search for
      Returns:
      A list of possible matches for the user to pick from. Returns an empty list if nothing was found.
      Throws:
      DatabaseException - If a database error is encountered.

    • getListOfPersonsFromResultSet

      private List<Person> getListOfPersonsFromResultSet(ResultSet resultSet) throws SQLException
      Creates a list of Person object from the rows of a ResultSet returned from the Person table.
      Parameters:
      resultSet - A ResultSet from the Person table with the cursor in the default position.
      Returns:
      A List of Person objects. Will return an empty list if the ResultSet is empty.
      Throws:
      SQLException - If the ResultSet is not from the Person table (i.e. the column names don't match)

    • getPersonFromResultSet

      private Person getPersonFromResultSet(ResultSet resultSet) throws SQLException
      Helper method to create a Person object from a Result Set from the Person table. Normally you would not call this method directly which is why it is private. This method gets called by the getListOfPersonsFromResultSet method. This method expects the cursor of the ResultSet to be pointing at a valid row.
      Parameters:
      resultSet - A ResultSet from the Person table pointing at a valid row.
      Returns:
      A Person object created from the information returned.
      Throws:
      SQLException - If the column names don't match (i.e. the ResultSet didn't come from the Person table.

    • updatePerson

      public boolean updatePerson(Person personToUpdate, String column, String newValue) throws DatabaseException
      Creates an UPDATE query to update one value in the record related to the given Person object
      Parameters:
      personToUpdate - The person being updated
      column - The database column name being updated
      newValue - The new value as a String (all the fields of the Person object are Strings)
      Returns:
      true if the database is modified.
      Throws:
      DatabaseException - If an error occurs with the database.

    • likeSanitize

      private static String likeSanitize(String input)

      Helper method for escaping the wildcard characters used in the SQL LIKE clause from a string. Because the search method uses Prepared Statements to avoid injection attacks, it would normally escape the wildcard characters that we insert when doing the fuzzy search. So we escape them here with a '!' before putting them in the Prepared Statement.

      Note: This method only escapes the LIKE wildcard characters. All other special SQL syntax is not modified and the resulting string should not be considered "safe" to be inserted into a raw SQL string. You still need to use a PreparedStatement to escape any other special characters from the string.

      This technique is not my design and was obtained from this Stack Overflow Discussion.

      Parameters:
      input - The String to be sanitised
      Returns:
      The (partially) sanitised string.

    • close

      public void close() throws SQLException
      Closes the connection to the database. Call this function at the end of the program
      Throws:
      SQLException - If an error occurs with the database connection.
